title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #1066: Independence Number of Unit Distance Graphs**

For n points in ℝ² with minimum distance 1, connected by edges at distance exactly 1, what is g(n) = guaranteed independent set size?

**Status:** OPEN

**Current Bounds:** (8/31)n ≤ g(n) ≤ (5/16)n
mathContext: Connects graph theory, planar graphs, the Four Colour Theorem, and discrete geometry.

title: Point in the Plane
content:
**Point2D:**

A point in ℝ², represented as EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2).

This is the basic building block for unit distance graphs.

title: Euclidean Distance
content:
**dist(p, q):**

Euclidean distance √(‖p - q‖²) between two points.

Used to define both the minimum distance constraint and unit distance edges.

title: Unit Distance Point Set
content:
**UnitDistancePointSet:**

A structure containing:
- points: Fin n → Point2D (n labeled points)
- min_dist: ∀ i ≠ j, dist(pᵢ, pⱼ) ≥ 1

This is the input to the problem: n points in ℝ² with pairwise distance at least 1.

title: Unit Distance Edge
content:
**unitDistanceEdge(P, i, j):**

Points i and j are connected by an edge iff:
- i ≠ j
- dist(pᵢ, pⱼ) = 1 exactly

This defines the graph structure on our point set.

title: Independent Set
content:
**IsIndependentSet(P, S):**

A set S of vertices is independent if no two vertices in S are at distance exactly 1.

Equivalently: no edges within S in the unit distance graph.

title: Independence Number
content:
**independenceNumber(P):**

The size of the largest independent set in the unit distance graph.

α(G) in standard graph theory notation.

title: The Function g(n)
content:
**g(n):**

The maximum k such that EVERY unit distance point set on n points has an independent set of size at least k.

This is the infimum over all configurations - the worst-case guarantee.

title: Asymptotic Density
content:
**gLimit:**

lim_{n→∞} g(n)/n - the asymptotic density of the guaranteed independent set.

Currently known to be in [8/31, 5/16] ≈ [0.258, 0.3125].

title: Planarity of Unit Distance Graphs
content:
**unit_distance_planar:**

Unit distance graphs with minimum distance 1 are always planar.

**Why?** If two edges crossed, the four endpoints would form a configuration where some pair is forced closer than distance 1.

title: Pollack's Lower Bound (1985)
content:
**pollack_lower_bound:**

g(n) ≥ n/4 for all n ≥ 1.

**Proof:** The Four Colour Theorem implies planar graphs are 4-colorable, so the largest color class has size ≥ n/4, and any color class is independent.

title: Csizmadia's Improvement (1998)
content:
**csizmadia_lower_bound:**

g(n) ≥ (9/35)n ≈ 0.257n

Improved over Pollack's n/4 = 0.25n using geometric arguments about the structure of unit distance graphs.

title: Swanepoel's Lower Bound (2002)
content:
**swanepoel_lower_bound:**

g(n) ≥ (8/31)n ≈ 0.258n

**Current best lower bound!**

Slightly improves Csizmadia's 9/35 ≈ 0.257.

title: Lower Bounds Comparison
content:
**lower_bounds_comparison:**

1/4 < 9/35 < 8/31

0.250 < 0.257 < 0.258

Shows the progression of lower bound improvements.

title: Erdős's Initial Conjecture
content:
**erdos_initial_conjecture:**

Erdős thought g(n) = n/3 ≈ 0.333n.

This was later **disproved** by constructions showing g(n) < n/3.

title: Chung-Graham-Pach Upper Bound
content:
**chung_graham_pach_upper_bound:**

g(n) ≤ (6/19)n ≈ 0.316n

Disproved Erdős's conjecture g(n) = n/3 ≈ 0.333n by explicit construction.

title: Pach-Tóth Upper Bound (1996)
content:
**pach_toth_upper_bound:**

g(n) ≤ (5/16)n = 0.3125n

**Current best upper bound!**

Improves over Chung-Graham-Pach's 6/19 ≈ 0.316.

title: Upper Bounds Comparison
content:
**upper_bounds_comparison:**

5/16 < 6/19 < 1/3

0.3125 < 0.316 < 0.333

Shows the progression of upper bound improvements.

title: Current Best Bounds
content:
**current_best_bounds:**

(8/31) < (5/16)

0.258 < 0.3125

Confirms the lower bound is below the upper bound (non-trivial!).

title: Gap Between Bounds
content:
**bound_gap:**

5/16 - 8/31 = 27/496 ≈ 0.054

The true value of lim g(n)/n lies somewhere in an interval of width about 5.4% of n.

title: Combined Current Knowledge
content:
**current_knowledge:**

(8/31)n ≤ g(n) ≤ (5/16)n for all n ≥ 1.

The complete state of the art, combining Swanepoel's lower bound and Pach-Tóth's upper bound.

title: Higher Dimensional Generalization
content:
**g_d(n):**

For n points in ℝ^d with minimum distance 1, the minimum number of points guaranteed to have pairwise distance > 1.

Generalizes g(n) = g_2(n) to arbitrary dimension.

title: Higher Dimension Question
content:
**erdos_higher_dimension_question:**

Is g_d(n) ≫ n/d in general?

Erdős asked whether the independent set size scales as n/d in dimension d.

title: Higher Dimension Upper Bound
content:
**higher_dimension_upper_bound:**

g_d(n) ≪ n/d is trivial.

**Construction:** Widely spaced unit simplices (d+1 points each, all at distance 1) give independent set at most n/(d+1).

title: Pach's Observation
content:
**pach_simple_four_coloring:**

For unit distance graphs, the Four Colour Theorem can be proved by a simple induction.

The full power of the Four Colour Theorem is not needed!

title: Planarity Intuition
content:
**planarity_intuition:**

If points have minimum distance 1 and edges connect distance-1 pairs, then edges cannot cross.

**Reason:** Crossing edges would force their endpoints into a configuration with some pair at distance < 1.

title: Related Problem 1070
content:
**related_to_1070:**

Problem 1070 asks for the general independence number of unit distance graphs (without the minimum distance constraint).

Related but different from the guaranteed size in Problem 1066.

title: Chromatic Number Bound
content:
**chromatic_number_bound:**

χ(G) ≤ 4 for unit distance graphs (since they're planar).

The tight bound for general unit distance graphs (without minimum distance 1) is still open!

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_1066:**

Combines the two verified facts:
1. (8/31) < (5/16) - lower bound is below upper bound
2. (5/16) - (8/31) = 27/496 - the gap is precisely 27/496

The problem remains OPEN to close this gap.

title: Historical Timeline
content:
**historical_timeline:**

- Erdős: Conjectured g(n) = n/3
- Pollack (1985): g(n) ≥ n/4 (Four Colour Theorem)
- Chung-Graham, Pach: g(n) ≤ 6n/19 (disproved n/3)
- Pach-Tóth (1996): g(n) ≤ 5n/16 (current best upper)
- Csizmadia (1998): g(n) ≥ 9n/35
- Swanepoel (2002): g(n) ≥ 8n/31 (current best lower)

title: Open Problem
content:
**main_open_problem:**

Determine lim g(n)/n exactly.

Currently: 8/31 ≤ lim g(n)/n ≤ 5/16.

Closing this gap is the main open challenge.
